ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gauged a better understanding of in depth analysis of texts. I learned how to interpret material and structure my papers so as to give them a good overall flow. Participation in class discussions and the readings enhanced my knowledge.

I gained a lot more confidence in my writing skills and ability to think logically. I also have a much greater understanding of various educational systems, and the ideas we encountered in class have greatly shaped my own beliefs on what makes an educational system effective.

How to construct an effective argument in essay format using various methods. These include constructing a thesis statement, using quotations smoothly, linking body paragraphs to support the overall argument, using interlocuter perspectives, and many more.
My writing skills and confidence to express myself have increased significantly.
Analytic writing, discussion/debate

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I honestly could not find any weaknesses. The course was fantastic and exceeded my expectations.

This course may have been the best course I've taken at Yale so far. Prof. Galindo is amazing, and I always felt very comfortable during the discussions despite having a fear of speaking in other seminars I've taken. The workload is reasonable, and Prof. Galindo is always there to support you when needed. I have no real criticisms of the course - I was genuinely excited to come to class every day and participate in the discussions, which I could have never imagined me saying before the course as I come from a very STEM-oriented background.

The only significant weakness was of course the compressed time period. There was not enough time to see an improvement in my writing or fully apply every writing technique introduced. However this was out of the control of the course, and I have no complaints about anything else.
A lot of open discussion allowing students to share their opinions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. This course was an effective way to stimulate critical thinking and consider different standpoints which may modify or strengthen your opinion or belief. The coursework was challenging but manageable, which I think is the perfect balance to any good course.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone. I was very insecure about my writing before taking this course, but now I am much more confident writer and acquired a greater appreciation for writing. I even started a journal after the course ended just to keep up with writing since I loved what we did in the course so much.

Yes! Although I did not choose this course based on the writing topic, I still found the subject matter intriguing and very relevant. I enjoyed discussing the readings and debating real-world issues in the small zoom classroom. The course also helped me start to improve my writing skills confidently, as I am not a strong writer in the first place.
Absolutely. The content is fascinating and the conversations it sparks are wonderful to be a part of.
Yes I would because it made me question my whole academic career.
Yes! Maria is a fantastic instructor and created a wonderful space for intellectual discussion and debate. She is also very encouraging and gives great feedback on the writing assignments.
